title: Parashant Grand Canyon-Parashant National Monument: Accessibility
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Accessibility             Accessibility       Parashant is a remote and isolated area with 1,200 miles of dirt, gravel, and rocky roads. There are few trails, no developed infrastructure, and no cell phone service.  Braille (.BRF) file of the text from the monument's primary brochure for use with a Braille Refreshable Display or to print braille pages at home with an embossing machine. If you have questions concerning accessibility, please contact us at (435) 688-3200 or email us.  Americans and permanent residents with a permanent disability of any age are eligible for the America the Beautiful National Parks and Federal Recreation Lands Access Pass. The Access pass is free, good for life, and provides free entry to national park areas and other federal areas that charge an entry fee. It also provides a wide range of discounts on federal lands.
